label: Adverse Events
structure: One record per adverse event per subject

children.label: Results in Death
children.name: AESDTH
children.notes: Did the serious event result in death?

children.label: Serious Event
children.name: AESER
children.notes: Is this a serious event?

children.label: Other Action Taken
children.name: AEACNOTH
children.notes: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Usually reported as free text. Example: “TREATMENT UNBLINDED. PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN NOTIFIED.”

children.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
children.name: AESDISAB
children.notes: Did the serious event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity?

children.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
children.name: AESOCCD
children.notes: Dictionary-derived code for the primary System Organ Class. Will be the same as AEBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

children.label: Primary System Organ Class
children.name: AESOC
children.notes: Dictionary-derived text description of the primary System Organ Class. Will be the same as AEBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

children.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
children.name: AESMIE
children.notes: Do additional categories for seriousness apply?

children.label: Location of Event
children.name: AELOC
children.notes: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event (e.g., ARM for skin rash).

children.label: Category for Adverse Event
children.name: AECAT
children.notes: Used to define a category of related records. Example: BLEEDING, NEUROPSYCHIATRIC.

children.label: High Level Group Term
children.name: AEHLGT
children.notes: Dictionary-derived text description of the High Level Group Term for the primary System Organ Class.

children.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
children.name: AESCONG
children.notes: Was the serious event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect?

children.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
children.name: AECONTRT
children.notes: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event?

children.label: End Relative to Reference Period
children.name: AEENRF
children.notes: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point (RFSTDTC) and a discrete ending point (RFENDTC) of the trial.

children.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
children.name: AEDECOD
children.notes: Dictionary-derived text description of AETERM or AEMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes.

children.label: Study Identifier
children.name: STUDYID
children.notes: Unique identifier for a study.

children.label: Reference ID
children.name: AEREFID
children.notes: Internal or external identifier such as a serial number on an SAE reporting form.

children.label: Body System or Organ Class
children.name: AEBODSYS
children.notes: Dictionary derived. Body system or organ class used by the sponsor from the coding dictionary (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor’s analyses and summary tables which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.

children.label: Causality
children.name: AEREL
children.notes: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH E2A and E2B examples include NOT RELATED, UNLIKELY RELATED, POSSIBLY RELATED, RELATED. Controlled Terminology may be defined in the future. Check with regulatory authority for population of this variable.

children.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
children.name: AERELNST
children.notes: Records the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE.”.

children.label: Involves Cancer
children.name: AESCAN
children.notes: Was the serious event associated with the development of cancer?

children.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
children.name: AEENRTPT
children.notes: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AEENTPT.

children.label: Occurred with Overdose
children.name: AESOD
children.notes: Did the serious event occur with an overdose?

children.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
children.name: AEOUT
children.notes: Description of the outcome of an event.

children.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
children.name: AESPID
children.notes: Sponsor-defined identifier. It may be pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor’s operational database. Example: Line number on an Adverse Events page.

children.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
children.name: AEACN
children.notes: Describes changes to the study treatment as a result of the event. AEACN is specifically for the relationship to study treatment. AEACNOTH is for actions unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Examples of AEACN values include ICH E2B values: DRUG WITHDRAWN, DOSE REDUCED, DOSE INCREASED, DOSE NOT CHANGED, UNKNOWN or NOT APPLICABLE.

children.label: End Reference Time Point
children.name: AEENTPT
children.notes: Description of date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AEENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".

children.label: High Level Group Term Code
children.name: AEHLGTCD
children.notes: Dictionary-derived code for the High Level Group Term for the primary System Organ Class.

children.label: Duration of Adverse Event
children.name: AEDUR
children.notes: Collected duration and unit of an adverse event. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).

children.label: Study Day of End of Adverse Event
children.name: AEENDY
children.notes: Study day of end of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

children.label: Severity/Intensity
children.name: AESEV
children.notes: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.

children.label: Domain Abbreviation
children.name: DOMAIN
children.notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

children.label: Pre-Specified Adverse Event
children.name: AEPRESP
children.notes: A value of “Y” indicates that this adverse event was pre-specified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms)

children.label: Sequence Number
children.name: AESEQ
children.notes: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

children.label: Body System or Organ Class Code
children.name: AEBDSYCD
children.notes: Dictionary derived. Code for the body system or organ class used by the sponsor. When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor’s analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.

children.label: Lowest Level Term Code
children.name: AELLTCD
children.notes: Dictionary-derived code for the Lowest Level Term.

children.label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event
children.name: AETERM
children.notes: Verbatim name of the event.

children.label: Preferred Term Code
children.name: AEPTCD
children.notes: Dictionary-derived code for the Preferred Term.

children.label: Unique Subject Identifier
children.name: USUBJID
children.notes: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

children.label: Study Day of Start of Adverse Event
children.name: AESTDY
children.notes: Study day of start of adverse event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

children.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
children.name: AEPATT
children.notes: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: INTERMITTENT, CONTINUOUS, SINGLE EVENT.

children.label: Modified Reported Term
children.name: AEMODIFY
children.notes: If AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.

children.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
children.name: AETOXGR
children.notes: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE). Sponsor should specify name of the scale and version used in the metadata (see Assumption 6d). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., “2” and not “Grade 2”).

children.label: Subcategory for Adverse Event
children.name: AESCAT
children.notes: A further categorization of adverse event. Example: NEUROLOGIC.

children.label: High Level Term
children.name: AEHLT
children.notes: Dictionary-derived text description of the High Level Term for the primary System Organ Class.

children.label: Group ID
children.name: AEGRPID
children.notes: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

children.label: High Level Term Code
children.name: AEHLTCD
children.notes: Dictionary-derived code for the High Level Term for the primary System Organ Class.

children.label: Is Life Threatening
children.name: AESLIFE
children.notes: Was the serious event life threatening?

children.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
children.name: AESHOSP
children.notes: Did the serious event require or prolong hospitalization?

children.label: Lowest Level Term
children.name: AELLT
children.notes: Dictionary-derived text description of the Lowest Level Term.
